metadata.title: CVE-2022-1734 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw in Linux Kernel found in nfcmrvl_nci_unregister_dev() indrivers/nfc/nfcmrvl/main.c can lead to use after free both read or writewhen non synchronized between cleanup routine and firmware downloadroutine.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1734` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-191-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-191-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-124-generic - 5.4.0-124.140~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-124-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-124.140~18.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-124-lowlatency - 5.4.0-124.140~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-191.202').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-124.140~18.04.1').
